title: Ticket #5741: Improve error reporting in queue-management interface
description:
When a request that's part of the schedd's queue-management interface fails, the client given an error core, but no message as to why it failed. If the client is using the NoAck flag, then they just see a closed connection, with no idea which part of their set of requests failed.

We now support returning an error message in response to a failed CommitTransaction. This was added for SUBMIT_REQUIREMENTS. We could use that to return error messages for failures that precede the CommitTransaction.

Ticket #5734 has a patch attachment that does this for the Owner check added there. It was deemed too risky for the stable series.
creator: jfrey
